LABEL: A rdfs:label
Definition: A definition SPLIT=|

LABEL: active learning
Definition: A skill realized in understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.

LABEL: active listening
Definition: A skill realized in giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.

LABEL: complex problem solving
Definition: A skill realized in identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.

LABEL: coordination
Definition: A skill realized in adjusting actions in relation to others' actions.

LABEL: critical thinking
Definition: A skill realized in using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.

LABEL: equipment maintenance
Definition: A skill realized in performing routine maintenance on equipment and determining when and what kind of maintenance is needed.

LABEL: equipment selection
Definition: A skill realized in determining the kind of tools and equipment needed to do a job.

LABEL: installation
Definition: A skill realized in installing equipment, machines, wiring, or programs to meet specifications.

LABEL: instructing
Definition: A skill realized in teaching others how to do something.

LABEL: judgment and decision making
Definition: A skill realized in considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.

LABEL: learning strategies
Definition: A skill realized in selecting and using training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things.

LABEL: management of financial resources
Definition: A skill realized in determining how money will be spent to get the work done, and accounting for these expenditures.

LABEL: management of material resources
Definition: A skill realized in obtaining and seeing to the appropriate use of equipment, facilities, and materials needed to do certain work.

LABEL: management of personnel resources
Definition: A skill realized in motivating, developing, and directing people as they work, identifying the best people for the job.

LABEL: mathematics
Definition: A skill realized in using mathematics to solve problems.

LABEL: monitoring
Definition: A skill realized in monitoring/Assessing performance of yourself, other individuals, or organizations to make improvements or take corrective action.

LABEL: negotiation
Definition: A skill realized in bringing others together and trying to reconcile differences.

LABEL: operation and control
Definition: A skill realized in controlling operations of equipment or systems.

LABEL: operation monitoring
Definition: A skill realized in matching gauges, dials, or other indicators to make sure a machine is working properly.

LABEL: operations analysis
Definition: A skill realized in analyzing needs and product requirements to create a design.

LABEL: persuasion
Definition: A skill realized in persuading others to change their minds or behavior.

LABEL: programming
Definition: A skill realized in writing computer programs for various purposes.

LABEL: quality control analysis
Definition: A skill realized in conducting tests and inspections of products, services, or processes to evaluate quality or performance.

LABEL: reading comprehension
Definition: A skill realized in understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.

LABEL: repairing
Definition: A skill realized in repairing machines or systems using the needed tools.

LABEL: science
Definition: A skill realized in using scientific rules and methods to solve problems.

LABEL: service orientation
Definition: A skill realized in actively looking for ways to help people.

LABEL: social perceptiveness
Definition: A skill realized in being aware of others' reactions and understanding why they react as they do.

LABEL: speaking
Definition: A skill realized in talking to others to convey information effectively.

LABEL: systems analysis
Definition: A skill realized in determining how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes.

LABEL: systems evaluation
Definition: A skill realized in identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the system.

LABEL: technology design
Definition: A skill realized in generating or adapting equipment and technology to serve user needs.

LABEL: time management
Definition: A skill realized in managing one's own time and the time of others.

LABEL: troubleshooting
Definition: A skill realized in determining causes of operating errors and deciding what to do about it.

LABEL: writing
Definition: A skill realized in communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience.
